concept.title: Preview and Edit the Pipeline
concept.shortdesc: The extended tutorial is almost done, so let's use data preview to see how stages transform data. While in data preview, we'll make some configuration changes and edit preview data for testing.

conbody.p: To preview the pipeline, click the preview icon: .

You can explore how each stage transforms data by selecting the stage and reviewing the input and output records in the Preview panel. Listed here are some details to note:
Field Masker Let's see how the Field Masker masks credit card numbers and change the mask type. To see how the Field Masker masks credit card numbers:
Select the Field Masker in the canvas, and then expand the first input and output record.
Scroll down and note that index 20 is highlighted, indicating a change.
Expand index 20 for the input and output data. Notice how all digits except the last 4 are masked.
Say we want to change the mask type to mask the whole credit card number. To review the stage configuration and try a different option:
On the left side of the Preview panel, select the Stage Configuration icon: .
You might need to scroll up to the top of the panel.
Click the Mask tab.
Change the Mask Type to Variable Length to mask all numbers while showing how many numbers there are in the data.
To view the data with this change, click the Run with Changes icon. Check if there's a New Data/Old data option later?
In the canvas, select the Field Masker processor and if the Preview panel displays the stage configuration, select the Records tab to view the preview records.
Expand an output record, expand index 20, and notice how the entire number is now masked.
Second Jython Evaluator The second Jython Evaluator flattens the delimited data. Let's take a look:
Select the second Jython Evaluator and expand the first input and output record.
Notice how the input record is a list of maps and the output record has been flattened to the following structure: <field name>: <value>. Isn't that great?
Field Converter The Field Converter changes the data type of a few fields. We'll take a look at that stage and try changing stage configuration.
To move the preview focus to the Field Converter, you can click the Next Stage icon instead of selecting the stage in the pipeline.
You might notice a red message that indicates the first record has an unparsable date - it shows that the date data includes invalid characters at the end.
So what happens to this bad record? It depends on how the stage is configured. We used the default configuration, but let's see what that is.
Click the Stage Configuration icon. Notice the On Record Error property is set to Send to Error.
This means error records are sent to the pipeline for error handling. And you might recall we configured the pipeline to write all error records to file. So with this configuration, the error record will be dropped from the pipeline and written to file.
You can configure this property to stop the pipeline on encountering an error record or to discard error records.
To see how it looks when you discard errors, set On Record Error to Discard. And then, click the Refresh Preview icon.
On the canvas, select the Field Converter stage, and then click the Records icon in the Preview panel. Notice the first record is discarded without notice of the error that occurred.
We prefer to keep error records, so go back to the Stage Configuration tab and change On Record Error back to Send to Error.
Second Expression Evaluator The second Expression Evaluator manipulates data. Let's try editing the preview data:
Click the Next Stage icon or select the Expression Evaluator.
If necessary, expand a couple input and output records.
Notice the fields created by the stage, pickup_location and trip_location, are highlighted in green.
Though it isn't necessary for these calculations, let's see how you can edit preview data to test stage configuration.
In the first input record - in the Input Data column, click on the Pickup Latitude data, 40.730068, add a negative sign before the data, and hit Enter or click outside the data.
The edited input data becomes red to indicate a change.
To test the change, click the Run Preview with Changes icon: .
The runs the preview with the change. Notice the corresponding output record now has -40.730068 for both pickup_latitude and pickup_location.
You can see how this functionality might come in handy when you want to test some cases that didn't come up in the preview data.
To revert that change, click the Revert Data Changes icon: .
This icon does not revert configuration changes.
